      • costAdditionalForFiremodeDuringShoot

        public java.util.List<AmmoBag> costAdditionalForFiremodeDuringShoot()
        returns a list of AmmoBag. The first element is the additional cost of the firemode (during shooting), the others are the optionals in sequence This method is for ZERO COST. Override it if the weapon has a cost
        Returns:
        a list with the ammo cost of the firemode

      • fire

        public void fire()
          throws WrongInputException
        Fires to the target. It comprehends the implementation for Targeting and pay Ammo cost, so use super.fire() in subclasses
        Specified by:
        fire in interface AddFireModeMethods
        Throws:
        WrongInputException - if invalid input

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(java.util.ArrayList<Target> target)
        Set targets in order to fire it
        Parameters:
        target - the targets

        Returns:
        a list of StringAndMessages of the expected messages and requests

      • addShoot

        public void addShoot(Shoot shoot)
        MANDATORY after the firemode is created in action it links the firemode to the shoot object
        Parameters:
        shoot - the action shoot

      • addTargetingScope

        public void addTargetingScope(int targetingCardID,
                              AmmoBag cost)
                       throws WrongInputException,
                              NotPresentException,
                              NotEnoughAmmoException,
                              FiremodeOfOnlyMarksException
        add a targeting scope. Use this method only if weapon shoots only visible targets, otherwise override it
        Specified by:
        addTargetingScope in interface AddFireModeMethods
        Parameters:
        targetingCardID - the targeting scope card ID
        cost - the ammo used for this powerup
        Throws:
        WrongInputException - if the action is invalid
        NotPresentException - if the card is not present in the player
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player has not enough ammo
        FiremodeOfOnlyMarksException - if the firemode only gives marks to the target, so targeting can't be used

      • addDamageAndMarks

        protected void addDamageAndMarks(Player targetPlayer,
                                 int numDamage,
                                 int numMarks,
                                 boolean useMarks)
        add damage and marks to a player
        Parameters:
        targetPlayer - the player shooted
        numDamage - number of Damage to apply
        numMarks - number of Marks to apply
        useMarks - true if you want to apply to damage the old marks, false if not (a targeting scope)

      • commonEndingFire

        protected void commonEndingFire()
                         throws WrongInputException
